predictions.text: The U.S. President will publicly name a nominee to serve as the next Federal Reserve Chair (successor to Jerome Powell) by 2026-02-07 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the White House (or the President in an official/public statement) names a specific person as the intended next Fed Chair by the deadline. Naming a shortlist without a single identified nominee does not count.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-29) reports markets focused on an imminent Fed chair pick; Trump said he would announce a replacement for Powell Friday morning.
monitoring_signals: White House press briefings / official statements
Major financial newswire alerts (WSJ, Bloomberg, Reuters) confirming a named nominee
President social media statements later echoed by White House
predictions.rationale: Public signaling suggests near-term announcement; timing risk comes from potential delays in vetting or shifting political priorities.

predictions.text: BLS CPI will show month-over-month seasonally adjusted CPI Shelter inflation of +0.20% or lower in at least one monthly CPI release with a reference month between 2026-02 and 2026-05, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any BLS CPI release (published by 2026-06-30) reports CPI-U Shelter (seasonally adjusted) m/m change <= +0.20% for any reference month from Feb 2026 through May 2026 inclusive.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-29) reports apartment rents dropped to the lowest level in four years, implying shelter disinflation pressure.
monitoring_signals: BLS CPI releases (tables for Shelter index m/m SA)
Private rent indices (Zillow, Apartment List) direction and lagged pass-through
Owner’s equivalent rent (OER) monthly prints
predictions.rationale: Private-market rent weakness often passes through to CPI Shelter with a lag, but the CPI methodology can delay or dampen the effect.

predictions.text: BEA will report the U.S. monthly trade deficit (goods and services, seasonally adjusted) at $95.0 billion or higher for at least one month in releases published by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any BEA 'U.S. International Trade in Goods and Services' release dated on or before 2026-06-30 reports a seasonally adjusted monthly deficit >= $95.0B for any reference month.
evidence: BEA (reported in summary) notes a surge in the U.S. trade deficit in November 2025 despite tariffs, indicating persistent import demand.
monitoring_signals: BEA monthly trade releases (headline balance)
Advance goods trade balance (Census) as an early indicator
Oil import value swings and consumer-goods import trends
predictions.rationale: Recent deficit widening suggests elevated probability of another very large monthly print, though services balance and energy prices can swing totals.

predictions.text: Amazon will publicly announce a strategic investment (equity or equity-linked) in OpenAI totaling at least $5.0 billion (USD) in disclosed proceeds by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Amazon and/or OpenAI publicly discloses a transaction (press release, SEC filing, official blog) in which Amazon invests >= $5.0B total (single or staged amounts explicitly summed) into OpenAI by the deadline. Rumors without official disclosure do not count.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-29) reports Amazon is exploring up to $50B investment in OpenAI, indicating active discussions.
monitoring_signals: Amazon investor relations releases and 8-K filings
OpenAI official announcements
Regulatory filings if any (e.g., antitrust/Hart-Scott-Rodino reporting disclosures where applicable)
predictions.rationale: Exploratory reporting increases odds, but deal size/structure and regulatory scrutiny create meaningful cancellation risk.

predictions.text: NHTSA will escalate its Waymo-related safety probe by opening an Engineering Analysis (EA) and/or will announce a safety recall (voluntary or mandated) covering Waymo vehicles/software, by 2026-07-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NHTSA publicly posts an EA opening tied to the Waymo incident(s) or publicly announces a recall campaign (Waymo or vehicle platform) explicitly linked to Waymo’s ADS behavior, by the deadline.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-29) reports NHTSA is investigating a Waymo robotaxi incident involving a child, increasing likelihood of formal escalation.
monitoring_signals: NHTSA ODI database updates (PE/EA status changes)
NHTSA recall database entries mentioning Waymo
Waymo safety statements and software update disclosures
predictions.rationale: High-visibility incidents can prompt escalation, but NHTSA frequently closes probes without EA/recall if evidence is insufficient.

predictions.text: Venezuela will publicly announce at least one new or amended oil-sector joint venture/operating agreement with a foreign company from {Chevron, Eni, Repsol, TotalEnergies, CNPC, Rosneft} by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if PDVSA, Venezuela’s government, or a named foreign counterparty publicly discloses (press release, official gazette, investor filing) a new or amended JV/operating agreement for upstream oil production in Venezuela by the deadline.
evidence: NYT (2026-01-29) reports Venezuela approved a sweeping oil-sector overhaul aimed at restructuring participation and investment terms.
monitoring_signals: PDVSA/government announcements and official gazette publications
Foreign partner filings (earnings calls, annual reports) referencing Venezuela contract changes
OFAC licensing/news that could enable Western participation
predictions.rationale: Legal overhaul raises probability of at least one formalized new/amended deal, though sanctions and counterparties’ risk tolerance are constraints.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Defense will publicly confirm the deployment (arrival or ordered movement) of an additional aircraft carrier strike group (CSG) to the U.S. Central Command area of responsibility by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if DoD (press release, briefing transcript, official X/website) confirms an additional CSG deployment to CENTCOM AOR relative to the baseline on 2026-01-30. Routine port calls outside CENTCOM do not count.
evidence: NYT (2026-01-29) reports the U.S. is weighing expanded military options and force buildup near Iran, implying elevated regional escalation posture.
monitoring_signals: DoD and Navy public affairs releases on CSG movements
CENTCOM statements
Credible tracking corroborated by official confirmation
predictions.rationale: Heightened Iran contingency planning often drives visible naval posture changes, but deployments may be substituted by air assets or kept ambiguous.

predictions.text: At least one Parkinson’s disease blood test intended for early detection will receive an FDA Breakthrough Device Designation, and the designation will be publicly disclosed by the developer, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if a company/university spinout publicly states it received FDA Breakthrough Device Designation for a blood-based Parkinson’s detection/early diagnosis test by the deadline (press release, website, SEC filing). Peer-reviewed publication alone does not count.
evidence: ScienceDaily (2026-01-29) highlights a blood test that may detect Parkinson’s years early, suggesting translational momentum.
monitoring_signals: Company press releases and FDA Breakthrough Device program disclosures
Clinical trial registrations moving from feasibility to pivotal design
Investor presentations citing FDA Breakthrough status
predictions.rationale: Promising research exists, but FDA-designation timing depends on developer readiness, clinical evidence, and regulatory strategy.
